ilog.cplex

Class IloCplex.Serializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ilog.cplex.IloCplex.Serializer
  • Enclosing class:
    IloCplex

    public static class IloCplex.Serializer
extends java.lang.Object
    A serializer for remote object user functions.

    Instances of this class serialize primitive types (byte, short, int, long, float, double) into an array of bytes. The serialized data is compatible with the low-level serializers and de-serializers that can be created by the Callable Library (C API) routines CPXXserializercreate() and CPXXdeserializercreate().

    Proper serialization and de-serialization are required whenever data is passed to or returned from a user function because that function may run on a platform (combination of hardware and software) that represents low-level data differently.

    See Also:
    IloCplex.Deserializer

    • Method Detail

      • ensureCapacity

        protected void ensureCapacity(int capacity)

        Make sure the internal buffer has a capacity of at least capacity bytes.

      • getRawData

        public byte[] getRawData()
        Accesses a reference to the internal serialization buffer.

        This method returns a reference to the internal buffer that holds the serialized data. The content of this buffer should be treated read-only; otherwise, undefined behavior occurs. Adding new data to this serializer will invalidate the reference returned by this method.

        Returns:
        A reference to the internal serialization buffer.
        See Also:
        getRawLength()

      • getRawLength

        public int getRawLength()
        Accesses the number of valid bytes in the internal serialization buffer.

        This method returns the number of valid bytes in the buffer returned by getRawData(). The returned byte count is valid only until new data is added to this serializer.

        Returns:

        The number of valid bytes in the buffer returned by getRawData().

      • append

        protected void append(byte b)

        Appends a single byte to this serializer.

        The internal buffer is not resized and must have enough space to hold the byte.

      • add

        public void add(byte b)

        Adds a single byte to this serializer.
